text:
A faint cry echoed in the room. Katerina Ivanovna held her husband’s lifeless body. 

“He’s got what he wanted,” she sobbed. “What now? How will I bury him? What will I feed them tomorrow?”

Raskolnikov approached her. 

“Katerina Ivanovna,” he said softly. “Your husband spoke of you with reverence. We became friends.”

He pulled out twenty roubles. 

“Take this. It may help. I’ll return tomorrow.”

He hurried out, pushing through the crowd. 

Suddenly, he bumped into Nikodim Fomitch.

“Ah, is that you?” Nikodim asked.

“He’s dead,” Raskolnikov replied. “The doctor and priest have been. Don’t burden her. Cheer her up.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov offers financial assistance to Katerina Ivanovna after her husband's death, expressing his respect for the deceased.
